TopicTitle: 1.0.5 is out!!!!! post your fist craft here.

Articles.Content:
just a little experiment with the thrust reversal on the jet engines.

http://i.imgur.com/9llsMBY.png

That is actually simple and brilliant!

Guys submarines are now super super easy! Jets still work under water brilliantly so you can explore the ocean depths!

...

OMG so many possibilities! Damn you squad!

Dammit, I thought I had a handle on my KSP addiction - and then this! D:

Dammit, I thought I had a handle on my KSP addiction - and then this! D:

What? How? Getting a handle of it? Are you a magician???

Triestse-like submarine, holds two Kerbals.

I have waited so long to be able to do this, and now its finally possible!

By jettisoning the ore, you can easily make the submarine shoot up to the surface.

See? it works amazingly well!

The biggest problem is surviving the landing...

Not sure what I should call this thing. Maybe the Flying Fish because of how it jumps out of the water when you jettison all the ore.

...Got my hands on 1.0.5, ditched an A320 and Bf 109 replica and my first cargo plane I called "Mein 1.0.5 Kampf" successfully. Other than the winglets from the A320, all the parts survived, and I managed to take off again in the Bf 109.

Unfortunately, I don't have the images with me right now.. Will post soon.
The tiny engines and the service bay make perfect VTOL engine housings.

http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/582448896001604768/45CE1150057264DB97C8A0789AAEFF61EEF2F494/

Richcas Kerman and the NAM-7C Turtle after the first successful circumnavigation on just J-20 Juno jets.

Is your plane rich with gas?(hahahahahahahaha)

Dammit, I thought I had a handle on my KSP addiction - and then this! D:

LOL, I am actually starting to worry a little about how much time I spend thinking about KSP.. It's.. just.. so.. glorious...

- - - Updated - - -

Triestse-like submarine, holds two Kerbals.

http://i.imgur.com/o5vFi0S.png

http://i.imgur.com/FJ9woLr.png

http://i.imgur.com/xiz3gHp.png

I have waited so long to be able to do this, and now its finally possible!

By jettisoning the ore, you can easily make the submarine shoot up to the surface.

http://i.imgur.com/wqB0fyb.png

http://i.imgur.com/XPpcUbp.png

See? it works amazingly well!

http://i.imgur.com/LWIDSi8.png

The biggest problem is surviving the landing...

Not sure what I should call this thing. Maybe the Flying Fish because of how it jumps out of the water when you jettison all the ore.

DAMN YOU MAN! I was in the process of maybe starting to think about one day making a Trieste replica. I wish we could 'occlude' water somehow to make submersible interiors though, that would rock.

Oh, here's an idea I had that I dont have time to make.

How about an underwater Laythe base and a sub that can go down and dock to it! How awesome would that be!!!

Now someone build it then give me all the credit.

Now we just need some transparent aluminum.

Someone build a B'rel to fit this whale!

- - - Updated - - -

Surprised that no one made a ship yet ...

http://i.imgur.com/vowatic.png

http://i.imgur.com/C61y94Y.png

i made a ship ....

Welcome to the forum! Nice ship!

Finally got a sub working in 1.0.5, I call it the Nemo-class.

It's pretty neat going all the way to the seabed; has anyone taken a sub to Laythe yet?

(snip)

It's pretty neat going all the way to the seabed; has anyone taken a sub to Laythe yet?

Yes indeed!

The real milestone I'm waiting for is Eve submarines, but I don't think we've seen any yet.

Yes indeed!

The real milestone I'm waiting for is Eve submarines, but I don't think we've seen any yet.

I'm tempted to try it (an Eve sub), though I suspect I'd have to reinforce it on the level I do my stock warships, just to deal with the sheer gravitational forces on Eve.

I'm tempted to try it (an Eve sub), though I suspect I'd have to reinforce it on the level I do my stock warships, just to deal with the sheer gravitational forces on Eve.

You'd be surprised. In that same thread, thanks to some mysterious bug-related circumstances, there is currently a contestant falling to the center of Kerbin. When he last checked in, his submarine was experiencing 6g, and so far nothing has fallen off. That's without any special reinforcement or anything. The challenge you're more likely to face on Eve is finding an efficient engine to keep you submerged for any length of time.

You'd be surprised. In that same thread, thanks to some mysterious bug-related circumstances, there is currently a contestant falling to the center of Kerbin. When he last checked in, his submarine was experiencing 6g, and so far nothing has fallen off. That's without any special reinforcement or anything. The challenge you're more likely to face on Eve is finding an efficient engine to keep you submerged for any length of time.

I've started building subs with pre-filled Ore tanks as ballast. However, to drop one on Eve... that's gonna be a BIG skycrane.
Through the miracle of thrust reversers, this airplane is climbing.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Assisted Superman !
I made a video about miniature crafts, like small ships or planes. That was the first thing I did in 1.05: build miniature crafts! ^^
Really nice mini sub! Majorjim, I picked a fine time to be doing the Elcano Challenge, i am halfway around Kerbin and can't update yet!

Really nice mini sub! Majorjim, I picked a fine time to be doing the Elcano Challenge, i am halfway around Kerbin and can't update yet!

Cheers mate. I will admit that it was supposed to be a little speed boat! Funnily enough, little subs actually sink better as they have few boyant parts.
The new parts let me make a mini-replica of the Liset landing craft from the online game Warframe that flies.
LOLZ that is amazing Love the craft, does it have Ordis?

Just a tiny test spaceplane. It's the smallest one I've ever made. Trying to make one that uses no engines bigger then 0.5m size. Using 3 Juno jet engines and 3 Spark rocket engines. So far I've gotten to 34Km with it. Got a long way to go yet before it can go orbital. Juno's drop out on too much power over 9Km though...

Not really my first craft, but the first one I actually bothered to save. My first craft was a basic Lear Jet replica using 2 Juno's on pylons... Nothing fancy but it flew ok.

Here's a proof-of-concept hydrofoil capable of 80 m/s. The front hydrofoil responds to pitch input and can be trimmed; the rear hydrofoil forces the hull down into the water when the brakes are activated.

Craft file
